normalised: gas cylinder prices give diwali cheer maybe

unnormalised: Hey folks, remember last month's gas cylinder price hike that left everyone feeling poorer than a bankrupt Raja? Well, there's some *slightly* good news. Sources say the government *might* be considering a minor price cut ahead of Diwali!
normalised: hey folks remember last month's gas cylinder price hike that left everyone feeling poorer than a bankrupt raja? well there's some slightly good news. sources say the government might be considering a minor price cut ahead of diwali!

unnormalised: No official word from the Petroleum Ministry yet, but whispers around Shastri Bhavan suggest a reduction of around Rs. 50 per cylinder. This could bring the price down to, maybe, Rs. 1100-ish in Delhi. Enough to buy an extra string of lights, perhaps?
normalised: no official word from the petroleum ministry yet but whispers around shastri bhavan suggest a reduction of around rupee fifty per cylinder. this could bring the price down to maybe rupee one thousand one hundred-ish in delhi. enough to buy an extra string of lights perhaps?

unnormalised: Of course, Rs. 50 is hardly going to make anyone throw a biryani party, but every little bit helps, right? Especially with Onam already done and dusted, and Diwali expenses looming large.
normalised: of course rupee fifty is hardly going to make anyone throw a biryani party but every little bit helps right? especially with onam already done and dusted and diwali expenses looming large.

unnormalised: Remember that time a kilo of onions cost more than petrol? Let's hope we aren't headed there with LPG too! Keep an eye on your Indane or Bharatgas apps for any updates. Fingers crossed, eh?
normalised: remember that time a kilogram of onions cost more than petrol? let's hope we aren't headed there with L P G too! keep an eye on your indane or bharatgas apps for any updates. fingers crossed eh?
